title: Was There an Insurrection on Jan. 6, 2021?
sub_head: Both sides seem to think the stakes are high.
body:
Regarding Jeffrey Shapiro’s op-ed “Stop Calling Jan. 6 an ‘Insurrection’” (Jan. 6): I was first made aware of the word “insurrection” as a teenager in 1965, when it was used widely in media to characterize the Watts riot in Los Angeles. No one argued with the word choice. It was true.
Years later, as a newspaper editor, I knew differences in denotation and connotation. A word in reasonable and general use might not apply in legal technicality. We might describe a backbenchers’ move on House leadership as an “insurgency.” In editorials, I sometimes decried taxation as “theft.”
